It belongs to the family Onocleaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, particularly in tropical rainforests. The plant exhibits a unique reproductive structure known as a sorus, which contains the spores necessary for its propagation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
